Case reference: 2014005809.CaseDesc: On June 8, 2012, Martha Kelly was last seen walking near her residence in Perth Andover, New-Brunswick. Martha suffered a brain injury in the past, leaving her at times with short term memory problems. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002160.CaseDesc: Jackelene Bylow was last seen at her residence on November 13, 1994 after having dinner at a restaurant near Willington Ave and Hastings St. She suffers from mental illness and addicted to drugs and alcohol.

Tattoo: Chest, Duck and blue bird on right breast

Case reference: 2006017399.CaseDesc: Mary Frances Gregory left her home in Parry Sound, Ontario on February 15, 1978, to vacation in California. She failed to arrive at her destination in Palo Alto, California and has not contacted any family members or friends since. Ms. Gregory is believed to have departed Canada by motor vehicle with a male acquaintance who states that he let her off at a bus station in Las Vegas, Nevada some ten days after leaving Canada. The driver claims to have driven to Nevada via the States of New York, Pennsylvania, Ohio, Illinois, Colorado, Utah, and Arizona.

Mark: Right Abdomen, Brown, in shape of 5 cent piece (10mm)

Case reference: 2014004949.CaseDesc: On June 3, 1968, it was reported that George Knott had been missing since the previous day. He had been traveling by boat between St. Theresa and Garden Hill, Manitoba. George's boat and dog were located. All attempts to locate him failed and he remains missing.

Scar: Left Shin, 1 inch lateral scar across left shin - axe wound
Left Knee, 1.5 inch lateral scar across inside left knee - axe wound
Left Foot, 1.5 inch lateral scar across top left foot - axe wound
1 inch lateral scar inside of right or left foot - axe wound

Case reference: 2010000899.CaseDesc: Wilfred Bruder was last spoken to on February 28th, 2004 while talking on a pay phone at the Willow West Mall in Guelph. This mall is adjacent to the Hanlon Expressway (Hwy 6) that runs north/south through the west end of Guelph. He was depressed and said his goodbyes to his ex-wife and children.  He had a history of depression and alcholism and was drinking heavily at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002936.CaseDesc: On February 3, 1988, David Ambroise, then 3 years old, was playing near the Saint-Maurice River in the First Nations reserve of Wemotaci. David approached too close to the water, slipped and fell in. He was then swept away by the current, and has never been found despite searches.

Case reference: 2013000052.CaseDesc: Denis Lapensée was last seen on May 28, 1998, in Montreal and was reported missing on June 2, 1998. Mr. Lapensée suffers from schizophrenia and was very depressed following a breakup with his spouse. He has previously mentioned that he intends to throw himself off the Jacques Cartier Bridge. M. Lapensée has bad dentition, is right-handed and smokes a pipe.

Hat: White, toque, blue and red polka dot

Case reference: 2014006179.CaseDesc: On July 8, 2013, Burnaby RCMP were advised that Lon Batchelor had sent his brother a letter requesting he become his power of attorney and that he give his daughter a good-bye note (stating that Lon was "going for the long walk"). This is out of character for Lon. Anyone having seen Lon since July 1, 2013, or who may be able to provide any information as to his whereabouts, is asked to contact the police.

Case reference: 2019012891.CaseDesc: Dean Brett Todd was last seen by his brother, around Easter time in 2000, near First Memorial Services Kamloops (formerly Schoening Funeral Home) on Tranquille Road in Kamloops, British Columbia. Dean had been invited to dinner, but did not show up. Dean is known to travel between Kamloops and Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2009005399.CaseDesc: Brian Henry was last seen in North Bay, Ontario on May 5, 1974, at approximately 3:00pm. On that day, his father drove him to Canadore College, so he could walk the nature trails.

Jacket: May have been wearing a green work jacket
May have been wearing a dark blue work jacket
Denim, Blue, "Coca Cola" logo on left pocket
Watch: Black, With a large black strap, glowed in the dark
Hat: Black, Cowboy or scout type hat

Case reference: 2012020113.CaseDesc: On September 11, 2004, Sylvie Menard was reported missing in Trois-Rivières, Quebec. Sylvie was last seen at approximately 1:00 p.m. in a licensed establishment located at the intersection of 3rd Row and Highway 359 (Main Street) in Saint-Luc-de-Vincennes, Quebec.

Case reference: 2013000142.CaseDesc: Richard Dryland was known to be homeless in the Grande Prairie, Alberta area. Mr. Dryland lived a transient lifestyle and often travelled to BC. In November 1993, he was released from the Peace River Correctional Centre. His family has not heard from him since.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm , Heart and dagger

Case reference: 2013000141.CaseDesc: Brandyn Dirienzo was last seen on the evening of October 4, 2006, entering an apartment building in Chilliwack, B.C. Brandyn was living a high risk lifestyle and foul play is heavily suspected. The police investigation into the disappearance of Brandyn is focussed on identifying those who have directly caused Brandyn's disappearance and/or death.  Investigators are looking for any information from anyone who has knowledge on the whereabouts of Brandyn. Brandyn is the father of two young children and his family is deeply affected by his disappearance.

Teeth: Crooked, Current photos seem to indicate a possible broken, upper right, front tooth
Jacket: Cotton, Black, Hooded Sweatshirt with "G-Unit" logo

Case reference: 2014005039.CaseDesc: On October 28, 1983, Azim Ramji was seen for the last time as he left his home in Kitchener, Ontario, after telling his family that he was leaving for Niagara Falls. Later that day, Azim’s vehicle was found at the Skylon Tower in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Azim was despondent.

Case reference: 2014004330.CaseDesc: On the 27th of December, 2002, at approximately 9 a.m., Jaroslav Heindl was last seen by the Lakeshore IGA Food Store in Regina, SK. Mr. Heindl was known to collect discarded items from around stores and other locations. His vehicle was located nearby, however, searches and investigations have failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2014001203.CaseDesc: On March 12, 2012, the body of a man was found in the ice of the St. Lawrence River near the Parc des Rapides in Lasalle. The man was not wearing winter clothes. A lighter in the right front pocket of his jeans was found.

Sweater: color burgundy with a collar and a zipper

Case reference: 2021045206.CaseDesc: On September 3, 2021, Mark Dolan was last seen by his family when he was dropped off at a bus terminal in Brantford, Ontario. His last banking transaction was captured on video at 294 Louisa Street in Parry Sound, Ontario, on October 28, 2021.

Luggage: Other, Multi coloured hiking style backpack.

Case reference: 2013000081.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1995, John Kargakos was reported missing when he was last seen swimming by a neighbour in Lac St-Louis au bord de l'eau located in the Dorval district of Montreal, Quebec. John has Alzheimer’s disease.

Case reference: 2017045266.CaseDesc: On August 7, 2017, James Candy was reported missing from his residence north of Lavoy, Alberta. James was last seen in his bedroom the night before on August 6, 2017 at approximately 11:00 pm.

Case reference: 2014041781.CaseDesc: William Leslie has not been seen or heard from by anyone, including his family, since September, 1993. Mr. Leslie's belongings were found in a remote area. He had been staying in a tent in the bush Southeast of Beaverlodge in Alberta. It appeared the tent was pitched in the fall of 1993. His belongings were located under 2-3 feet of snow, along with his truck and bicycle. A jean jacket and leather jacket were located in the truck.

Hair: Brown, Shoulder, Short on top and long in back
Tattoo: Left Arm, "live your own life" in a ribbon

Case reference: 2020028767.CaseDesc: In the late evening of August 24, 1975, Jean-Marc Meagher was seen for the last time in Berthierville, Quebec.

Case reference: 2014006557.CaseDesc: Alvin Berg, 35 years old, was originally from the Pierceland District, SK. He was working as a farm labourer in the Spinney Hill district near Maymont, SK. Mr. Berg was last seen when he left this farm in October of 1940, after which he had no further contact with his family.

Case reference: 2008007698.CaseDesc: John McColl left a note at his parent's home on January 27, 1979 stating that he was travelling to Nassau, Bahamas via the United States. He is known to have visited with friends in London, Ontario at the beginning of December, 1979.  Also, he purchased an airline ticket on December 14, 1979 in San Francisco. Family had noted that Mr. McColl was depressed at the time.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Middle Finger, previous break from injury/trauma

Case reference: 2014003919.CaseDesc: On September 19, 2000, Ronald Montgomery went missing from his home in Calgary. He has not been heard from since.

Case reference: 2013000004.CaseDesc: John Wade left his parents’ home in Halifax, NS on June 17, 2012. He left on foot while distraught, leaving behind his identification, bank card and money. He has been known to reside on the streets and does have connections to Edmonton, AB. Mr. Wade has previously hitchhiked across Canada. He suffers with mental illness and is diagnosed with schizophrenia.

Teeth: Good, Upper front tooth is capped

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2014001143.CaseDesc: The remains of a male were found on July 14, 1979 floating in the Peace River about 16 kms north of the town of Peace River. It is estimated this individual died between 8 and 10 months prior to recovery. There was extensive dental work present.

Case reference: 2013000053.CaseDesc: On October 20 2010, OPP were called to the Iroquois Locks, Iroquois ON by the Captain of a Bulk Laker reporting that crew member Gary Charlton had not shown up for his noon shift.  Crew members and the OPP conducted searches of the vessel without locating Charlton.  He was last seen on the vessel by crew members at 4:10 a.m., October 20, 2010 when the vessel was in Lake Ontario in the Cobourg area.

Case reference: 2017073543.CaseDesc: On May 30, 2016, the remains of an unidentified male were discovered in the Niagara River located in Ontario. Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts this person was of East Asian ancestry.

Case reference: 2016059681.CaseDesc: On October 22, 2016, at approximately 7:30 a.m., Asal Baradran and her father, Amir Baradran, were seen for the last time leaving their home in Toronto, Ontario. The pair had advised that they would be back at 8:00 p.m., but did not return home.

Case reference: 2018063272.CaseDesc: On February 13, 2002, Wayne McMahon was seen for the last time by his building's superintendent in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020081.CaseDesc: Emily Osmond (Laplante) lived a reclusive lifestyle on a small acreage on the Northern edge of Kawacatoose First Nation. Emily seldom had contact with her family or friends and the last known contact with them was August 29, 2007. She was last seen on the 9th of September, 2007, by her hired helper. Her disappearance is very unusual. Her vehicle and personal belongings including medication were left at her residence. She also had dogs at her acreage that she cared for that were left unattended. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Emily.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2014002303.CaseDesc: On October 8, 1960, Herbert Lafferty was seen for the last time as he checked rabbit snares with his grandfather, just outside of Fort Resolution in the Northwest Territories. Herbert did not return from checking those snares, and some of his friends had reported that Herbert had indicated that he had made plans to rejoin his mother in British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014006004.CaseDesc: On February 1, 2013, Timmothy Benedict-Leaf was last seen at his family residence in Akwesasne, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001430.CaseDesc: On July 28, 1980, Robert Wiggins was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2014004732.CaseDesc: Waylon Edwin Smith was last seen in the Lake St. Martin area of Manitoba.  He had lived in Winnipeg and gone to Lake St. Martin to visit family.  He went for a walk and never returned.  He suffered from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014001642.CaseDesc: In October of 1983, Edna Smith, 24 years old, was last seen at a camp with two other persons on East Trout Lake located approximately 120 kilometers north of Prince Albert, SK. A search party located the bodies of the two companions, however, she has never been located. A boat the trio had previously used was found capsized in the lake and it was suspected that all three individuals drowned.

Deformity: Mouth, cleft Palate had been operated on

Case reference: 2012020142.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2008, Shannon Alexander, 17 and Maisy Odjick, 16, were reported missing from the First Nation community of Kitigan Zibi in Quebec. This community is located near the town of Maniwaki. On September 5, 2008, the two girls went to the Maniwaki arena, where several young people were present. Maisy then went to spend the night at Shannon’s house. Shannon’s father was the last person to have seen his daughter on September 6, 2008. In 2015 an age progression was done for both Maisy and Shannon.

Pierce: Mouth, 2 loops on the lower lip

Case reference: 2015011673.CaseDesc: On July 26, 1992, a man fell to his death fifty feet from Complexe Desjardins in Montreal. The man would possibly be Asian.

Case reference: 2014000015.CaseDesc: On March 28, 2012 Allan Kinkaid was reported missing to the Calgary Police Service. Mr. Kinkaid had moved to Las Vegas, Nevada in 2006. He last had contact with his family in Calgary on December 25, 2009.

Hair: Brown, Straight, Other, Blonde patch, medium length

Case reference: 2006009199.CaseDesc: On July 09, 2003, Michael Linklater, his father and brother went to the Linklater family hunting & fishing camp; located near mile marker 115 on ONR Railroad line, between Cochrane and Moosonee. Mr. Linklater left the camp at about 6:00 a.m. on July 13, 2003, and has not been seen since. His father and brother searched for hours before going to mile marker 126 and calling the police. An extensive search in the area has failed to locate Mr. Linklater.

Case reference: 2017060465.CaseDesc: On September 24, 2017, Jesse Clint Galganov was seen for the last time when he took a flight to Peru from the Montréal-Pierre-Elliott Trudeau Airport in Montreal, Quebec. On September 28, 2017, Jesse contacted his mother to tell her that he was going to go hiking for a few days in the forest. Since this time, Jesse has not been seen nor has he contacted his family to provide them with his whereabouts which is contrary to his habits.

Shoes: Black, White, Running shoes with white soles

Case reference: 2018062818.CaseDesc: On April 26, 1993, at approximately 1:30am, Rafat Abugazia was last seen by his roommate in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005757.CaseDesc: Harley Boxall was seen leaving his residence in Nanaimo on March 9, 2012. A suicide note was located in his room suggesting he was going to drown himself. However, within weeks of being reported missing, there were unconfirmed reports of Mr. Boxall within the city of Nanaimo or that he may be residing with the homeless community in Vancouver’s lower-Eastside.

Case reference: 2014002991.CaseDesc: On August 23, 1988, Roberta Ferguson and eight other youths went to Sunnyside Campground at Cultus Lake in Chilliwack, BC. On August 24, 1988, Ms. Ferguson left the group on foot, it is believed she intended to return to her home in Surrey, British Columbia. Witnesses reported having seen a female walking on Columbia Valley Road, and others reported having seen a female getting into a vehicle at the intersection of Vedder Road and Cultus Lake Road. Ms. Ferguson has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014002824.CaseDesc: On July 20, 1985, Sidney Manning was reported missing by his family in Chilliwack, British Columbia. On July 17, 1985, Sydney departed from Cultus Lake, B.C. in his brown 1984 Oldsmobile. On August 4, 1985, his vehicle was located abandoned on a forest service road in Hope, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006005299.CaseDesc: On August 22, 1970, Joseph Valem and two friends went fishing in a 16 foot fibreglass boat. Their boat sank on Georgian Bay, near Giants Tomb Island.  Mr. Valem is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2016068706.CaseDesc: On June 19, 1967, an unidentified male, believed to be between the ages of 35 to 50 years old, was found in the water chute at the rear of 115 Cameron Avenue in Dundas. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180 lbs and his length was measured at 6'0", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He was found naked. His appendix was present. He is believed to have been dead for 3 to 4 weeks.

Teeth: Visible Missing, A single amalgam filling is noted, as well as, an unerrupted 2nd molar. Many teeth of the lower jaw missing.

Case reference: 2020015197.CaseDesc: On May 15, 2020, Tony Noskey was seen for the last time as he was riding a four-wheel all-terrain vehicle with his friends near the community of Cadotte Lake in Alberta. During the course of this outing, Tony had disappeared into the bush, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2018029665.CaseDesc:
On May 29, 2018, at approximately 12:40 p.m., Vernon Otto last spoke with his wife
over the telephone, as he was on their property in St. Clements, Manitoba. During the
course of their conversation, Vernon had told his wife that he was going to speak with
a neighbour about vehicle ramps he had lent to him. Vernon had also told her that he
was going to go the Interlake area to look at farm machinery, specifically a crawler.
Vernon's truck was found burnt on May 30th, 2018, at 5:20 pm, a few miles from his
residence.

Case reference: 2014001125.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1985, the body of a small, middle aged man was recovered from the water in False Creek in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had a tattoo on his right forearm and is believed to have jumped off the Granville Bridge approximately one month earlier.

Case reference: 2007005499.CaseDesc: Lindsey Nicholls was 14 years old when she disappeared in 1993. She left the group home where she was living in the Comox Valley, BC at about 10:30 a.m. after having an argument with her foster mother. She was last seen walking away from the residence to visit some friends in Courtenay. She left all of her belongings and treasures in her room; she did not seem to be planning to run away.

Case reference: 2004005470.CaseDesc: Tamra Jewel Keepness disappeared from her home on Ottawa Street in Regina, Saskatchewan when she was just 5 years old. She went missing from her bedroom sometime overnight.

Pants: Denim, Blue, Pockets on the front

Case reference: 2009001499.CaseDesc: Louis Riklik was last seen on October 12, 2008, in the Toronto area. On October 19, 2008, Mr. Riklik entered the Bruce Peninsula National Park. His vehicle, a blue 2003 Mazda minivan, was located at the Halfway Log Dump Road parking lot. This is an access point to the Bruce trail. An extensive ground, air and water search was conducted by the OPP, Mr. Riklik was not found.

Case reference: 2018054233.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2018, Xinye Wang was last seen in China. Xinye was scheduled to return to Canada but has not been heard from or seen since.

Case reference: 2014005030.CaseDesc: Wilfrid Langlois has been missing since February 5, 1998. At the time of his disappearance, it is possible that he was in the Chandler area of the Gaspé Peninsula.

Case reference: 2006000499.CaseDesc:
On July 12, 1989, the body of a male was recovered from the Whirlpool basin in the Niagara River. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 167lbs and his length was measured to be between  5’9"-5’10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
His appendix was present.
He was recovered without any clothing or personal effects. It is estimated that he had been in the water for some days to weeks prior to recovery.

Hair: Black, Curly, Tightly curled, male pattern baldness and a moustache
Teeth: Severe crowding of ant. teeth, Most post. teeth are amalgam restorations, U-Left 1st premolar & 3rd molars: lost before death
Scar: Small 1.5cm oblique scar on his right knee

Case reference: 2006007299.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1985, Byron Simmons and Julie Ann Schneider were observed fishing from a boat in Lake Huron. They were near the Nuclear Power Generation Station, near Inverhuron, Ontario, in the outflow from the nuclear plant. The couple failed to return to their cottage and are presumed drowned.  Their boat was recovered the following spring washed up on shore to the north, near Oliphant, Ontario.

Hair: Grey, White, Other, Short, Afro style

Case reference: 2018070318.CaseDesc: In the summer of 1983, Angela Hartmann left home to travel to Ottawa, Thunder Bay, and Calgary before attending fall classes at Trent University in Peterborough, Ontario. It is believed that Angela's last known location was in August of 1983 in Ottawa, Ontario at the Ottawa Youth Hostel.

Case reference: 2006006199.CaseDesc: Donald Douma has been missing since May 19, 1981. Donald was an avid outdoorsman and he occasionally hitchiked. He was last seen leaving home on a blue CCM bicycle. Donald Douma had expressed interest in moving out West and his family believes that is where he may have gone to.

Teeth: Crooked, Some dental work, upper front tooth has had some white fillings.

Case reference: 2014005436.CaseDesc: On May 5, 2009, Mohamed Ibrahim was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2006023799.CaseDesc: On July 12, 1999, Jerzy Ryglewicz was last seen at a gas station in Merrickville. He has not been seen or made contact with any friends or family since.

Case reference: 2010003099.CaseDesc: On July 23, 2010, OPP received a report that support cheques for Shelley Anderson of Cobalt Ontario, were returned uncashed for the past 12 months. Police attempted to locate her but were unsuccessful. She was last seen in the Haileybury and Cobalt area some time during the summer of 2009. Ms. Anderson also has ties to the Timmins and Schumacher areas, as she lived there for most of her life.

Case reference: 2014005579.CaseDesc: In the early hours of January 17, 1991, Darrell Watt was seen for the last time as he left the Beverly Crest Hotel tavern in Edmonton, Alberta. During the time of his disappearance, Darrell was engaged in a high risk lifestyle and was a known associate of a motorcycle club.

Case reference: 2008006298.CaseDesc: On October 3, 1996, Audrey Desjardins dropped her friend/co-worker at her residence in Welland after working a night shift.  Mrs. Desjardins was driving a red four-door 1985 Ford Crown Victoria.  The car was in excellent condition and there was a Canadian flag bumper sticker on the left rear bumper.

Boots: Black, running shoe styled work footwear
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Brown, 2 brown stripes on front going to shoulders, belte

Case reference: 2012020002.CaseDesc: Perry Sebastian was last seen December 26, 2011. Perry is from the Hagwilget First Nations reserve and reported missing from the Southbank area of Burns Lake, British Columbia. He was reportedly despondent.

Case reference: 2008006899.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1966, Mr. Wynacht and two of his friends went hunting North of Sudbury along hydro pole lines, 20 miles north of Gauthiers corners on hwy 69, Kitchener Township. As a snow storm picked up, the hunters got separated along the pole lines, and Mr. Wynacht vanished. On the morning of Saturday November 5, 1966, a police cruiser led the search of the area with 35 citizens and two aircrafts. The search was completed on November 15, 1966, with negative results and no clue as to his disappearance had been uncovered.

Shirt: Wool, Red, Black, Checkered heavy doe skin

Case reference: 2006011399.CaseDesc: Raymond Juranitch went hunting and fishing on the Ogoki Reservoir 80 km northeast of Armstrong, Ontario. He was last seen alone in a 16' aluminum canoe, powered by a 9.8 HP outboard motor. An extensive search of the area failed to locate Mr. Juranitch.

Case reference: 2013000109.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1996, Huguette Douville was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. She walks with an irregular gait, specifically a hunchback posture and always carries grocery bags. Huguette regularly hitchhikes.

Case reference: 2014002901.CaseDesc: On January 26, 1981, Carlos Yuste was residing with friends in Thompson, Manitoba. He departed the residence and never returned. Carlos left behind all his clothing and personal belongings. He was described by his friends as being very depressed due to his unemployment. Mr. Yuste has not been located and his whereabouts are unknown.

Aliases: GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel
YUSTE GARCIA DE LOS RIOS, Carlos Manuel

Case reference: 2011000299.CaseDesc: On September 2, 2010, the skeletal remains of a Caucasian male were found in the forest near Chemin Lac Clair in West Nipissing, Ontario. He is believed to have been there from two weeks to six months.

Hair: Brown, Short, Shorter than collar length
Teeth: Some dental work and some untreated dental disease
Other: Signs of arthritis in his feet. Bandages on them suggesting that he may have experienced pain

Case reference: 2014005364.CaseDesc: Antoinette Neveu was reported missing on January 11, 1991, after failing to arrive at her place of employment in Edmonton, Alberta. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014002692.CaseDesc: Between September 3 and October 3, 1978, Jean-Jacques Sirois was seen for the last time in the Rosemont District in Montreal, Quebec. Jean-Jacques has not been seen or heard from since.

Jewelry: Gold, Gold ring with rectangular cubic zirconia

Case reference: 2016070209.CaseDesc: On April 11, 2003, the body of a woman was recovered from the bank of the North Saskatchewan River near the Riverdale area of Edmonton, Alberta.

Jewelry: Metal, Yellow, RING, With multiple clear stones and three yellow stones.
Metal, Yellow, RING, Has a clear stone
Metal, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, NECKLACE, Religious medallion of the Madonna

Case reference: 2014001136.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1998, the body of a woman in a state of advanced decomposition believed to be between the ages of 30-49, was found near a dock on Charron Island located in the St. Lawrence River near Longueuil, Quebec. Her body would have been in the water for a number of months.

Scar: Abdomen, Scar from appendectomy, lower right side

Case reference: 2014003950.CaseDesc: Lyndon Fuller was last seen on November 25, 1988, in the area of the local hospital in Berwick, Nova Scotia. Lyndon had jumped from a third floor window following his admission to the hospital. Lyndon left on foot in an unknown direction.

Case reference: 2014002684.CaseDesc: On February 16, 1994, Mathieu Landry was reported missing by a traveling companion. Mr. Landry was renting a cabin at Juara village on Tioman Island in Malaysia when he went for a walk and never returned. Sunglasses belonging to Landry where found on the beach. His passport, clothing, backpack and other personal effects where recovered from the resort where he was staying. Land and water searches involving police divers where done and failed to locate him; he was presumed to have drowned.

Case reference: 2014004086.CaseDesc: On July 13,1981, Sophia Armstrong was seen for the last time. Her companion reported that she had gone on a trip, which was out of character for Ms. Armstrong.

Case reference: 2006019899.CaseDesc: Frank Uncapher was last seen on Lac Seul on October 21, 1974. He was on a hunting trip.

Case reference: 2014005974.CaseDesc: Éric Descoteaux's relatives have had no news of him since January, 2009. Mr. Descoteaux lived in the town of Harrington in the Laurentians.  He left there without warning, and stopped contacting his relatives.

Case reference: 2014003086.CaseDesc: On January 30, 1997, Maurizio Di Caprio was last seen in Montreal. He left for Chicoutimi or Toronto to bring a vehicle back to Montreal.

Case reference: 2014004904.CaseDesc: On the evening of April 5, 2007, Woon-Young Lee was seen for the last time at the West Park Health Centre in Toronto, Ontario.  When nurses came to Woon-Young's room the next day, she was gone.

Case reference: 2014002241.CaseDesc: In April of 1972, Velma Marie Duncan was last seen by her brother hitchhiking from the Gang Ranch area to Williams Lake, BC. Ms. Duncan arrived at her sister’s residence and attended the downtown core of Williams Lake with her sister on May 3rd or 4th, 1972. Ms. Duncan entered a local bar, which was the last time she was seen.

Case reference: 2014004085.CaseDesc: On December 27, 1999, Simon Farah was seen for the last time at his residence in the Verdun District in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Simon was suffering from mental health issues. He has not been seen and has not given any news to his family, which is contrary to his habits.

Case reference: 2015059300.CaseDesc: On October 30, 2015, at approximately 2:30 p.m., Tommy Chear was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Tommy had advised that he would be home later, but never returned.

Glasses: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Black, Framed, Framed glasses

Case reference: 2014006747.CaseDesc: Jian Ping Li and her 6 month old baby, Xiao Feng Lu, were last seen at their family residence in Brossard on April 30, 2014, around 9:40 a.m. When her husband returned, around 2:30 p.m., there was nobody home and the back door was unlocked.  Ms. Li's car was still at the residence. She left without her purse, her wallet, money, her credit card, and her cell phone, the diaper bag for the baby, the baby stroller and the car seat.

Case reference: 2014000012.CaseDesc: On March 16, 1968, an unidentified, medium built, Caucasian male was found in the Fraser River, near Bristol Island, BC . The deceased had 3 well-healed finger amputations on his left hand, a 3 cm scar on his chin, no teeth in his upper jaw and some teeth remaining in his lower jaw. The time of death is estimated between September 1967 and March 1968.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2006000299.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1989, an unidentified man collapsed on the sidewalk on Yonge Street, south of Front Street in Toronto, Ontario. The man was taken to St. Michael's Hospital, where he did not regain consciousness and subsequently died.

Hair: Grey, White, Short, Dark, bushy eyebrows, several days growth of a beard
Scar: Evidence of previous brain surgery (right-sided craniotomy).

Case reference: 2014002176.CaseDesc: On the evening of September 30, 1997, Michelle McGillion was seen for the last time in Fort McMurray, Alberta. During the time of her disappearance, Michelle was living a high-risk lifestyle and may have been despondent. She has ties to Alberta, Yukon, and Ontario where her family resides.

Case reference: 2012020088.CaseDesc: Norbert Couillonneur was last seen on Thursday, May 27, 2010, at Pinehouse Lake, SK, wearing blue jeans and a light blue t-shirt. He is known to travel back and forth from Pinehouse Lake to Canoe Lake, SK.

Case reference: 2015017928.CaseDesc: On December 17, 2000, this man was found under the Angrignon and Notre-Dame viaduct in Montreal. He was an itinerant who often slept there.

Case reference: 2012020086.CaseDesc: On May 13, 1993, Willard Brass, 52 years old, was last seen at a residence in Yorkton, SK. He was reported missing on May 27, 1993, by his family. Searches and investigation have failed to locate him.

Hat: Black, Red, ball cap, crest of sunsets, with horse and rider, "Black Hills South Dakota" in writing
Tattoo: Left Hand, love (text) and 4 aces across the fingers
Right Forearm, dagger and a heart
Left Forearm, born to be wild 1962 (text)

Case reference: 2014003230.CaseDesc: Mr. James McGrath was reported missing on May 31, 2001, by family members.  At the time of his disappearance he was residing near Patrick's Cove, NL.  Mr. McGrath lived alone, and was last seen walking on the roadway approximately seven days before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014005770.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1979, Thomas Lidguerre and Lawrence Sanger headed out from Fond du Lac to Uranium City on Lake Athabaska. The boat was located two days later, swamped near the Narrows and Popular Point. A search was conducted and lasted for over one month without any success in locating M. Lidguerre and M. Sanger.

Case reference: 2014001798.CaseDesc: On March 3, 1987, Nancy Dumas was reported missing. She was last seen by her daughter. Ms. Dumas had said that she was going to find her friends, and left her daughter's residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001648.CaseDesc: On August 31, 1986, Gustave Focktave was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Côte-Des-Neiges-Notre-Dame-De-Grâce District of Montreal, Quebec. Gustave had left without his possessions and had left a farewell letter addressed to his family indicating that he would be hitchhiking to British Columbia to live in Vancouver. Gustave is originally from Madagascar.

Case reference: 2014004467.CaseDesc: On November 16, 1997, Sadhi, Samia, Samir, and Saeed Jiredeh were last seen as they left their home with their father in Toronto, Ontario. That day, their parents had gotten into an argument prior to them leaving.

Case reference: 2006007399.CaseDesc: On January 5, 1991 Bruce Blimkie left the Riverview Inn in Norway Bay, Quebec, to travel home by snowmobile, across the Ottawa River, to Arnprior, Ontario.  It is believed that Mr. Blimkie was travelling in an area of the Ottawa River where there was open water, and that his snowmobile went through the ice into the water. He is presumed drowned.
